author: Special Correspondent
text:
St. Joseph’s College here signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Visual Media Software Technology, Krishnagiri, on Monday to digitize Sathuragarathi (one of the oldest Tamil dictionaries, compiled by Italy born missionary Veeramamunivar (Joseph’s Constantine Beschi) in 1732.

While Rev. F.Andrew, Principal, and T. Nedunchezhian, Associate Professor of the Department of Tamil and the Principal Investigator, signed the documents on behalf of St. Joseph’s College, Murali Selvaraj, Chairman, inked the documents of behalf of Krishnagiri Visual Media software Technology.

As per the project, the Sathuragarathi and all Tamil words compiled by Veeramamunivar will be uploaded under the four headings namely Peyar (Name), Porul (meaning), Thogai (collective noun) and Thodai (ryme and metre).

The Visual Media Technology will provide the technical support, and create a software data base.

Mr. Nedunchezhian said compilation of Veeramamunivar would also be created in e-book form. Moreover, there was a plan to create mobile app of Sathuragarathi. It will enable the researchers (M.Phil., Ph.D. and post doctoral scholars) in Tamil, English and other global languages to proceed with their further research.

They could search through search engines relevant words digitized and complied into an e-book in unicode.

He added that more than one lakh Tamil words would join Google search engine. It would increase the verbal wealth of the classical language Tamil tremendously. This was the first unique endeavour taken up in the world of Tamil research. The project would be completed within 2016-17 academic year.

Prof S.P.Benjanmin Elango, Coordinator, Public Relations, St. Joseph’s College, was present on the occasion.
title: MoU to digitise dictionary of Veeramamunivar
